Expansions Let’s play hide and seek.
Secret Folder 1Not here!Secret Folder 2No-no.Secret Folder 3You found me!Expansion can be in code!
1 2 3 you may notice there are line numbers... just use {linenos=true} See thisSuprise!Maths ðŸŽ‰ Follow the guide here to add math rendering.
This is an inline \(a^*=x-b^*\) equation. And this $f(x)=\sin{\omega x + \phi}$.
These are also block equations:
$$a^*=x-b^*$$$$ a^*=x-b^* $$Double-escape \\$ the symbol $:
A \$5 bill saved is a \$5 bill earned.
In integral you should use \mathrm{d} for $\mathrm{d}x$.
$$\begin{align}I &= \iint\limits_{\Omega} {\mathbf{n} \cdot \mathbf{w_{i}}} \, \mathrm{d}\mathbf{w_{i}} \\&=\int_{0}^{2\pi} \int _{0}^{\pi/2} {\cos\theta}\, \mathrm{d}\theta \, \mathrm{d}\phi \\&= \pi \end{align}$$Try some matrix.
Assume $M$ represents model transformation, then transformation matrix $Q$ for normal is:
$$Q = (M^{-1})^{\mathsf{T}}_{3\times 3}$$Which transpose looks better?
\intercal : $M^{\intercal}$
\top : $M^{\top}$
\mathsf{T} : $M^{\mathsf{T}}$
title: My very first post
